meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be modified or adjusted.
meanings.sent1: Her modulabilities allowed her to easily adjust to new situations.
meanings.sent2: The modulabilities of the software made it easy to customize for different users.
meanings.sent3: His modulabilities were put to the test when he had to quickly adapt to the unexpected changes.
meanings.sent4: The modulabilities of the building design were evident in its ability to transform for different functions.
meanings.sent5: The modulabilities of the material were crucial for the success of the project.

meanings.definition: The ability to be changed or adapted in various ways.
meanings.sent1: The modulabilities of the plan allowed for easy adjustments as needed.
meanings.sent2: Teachers appreciate the modulabilities of the curriculum to meet diverse student needs.
meanings.sent3: The modulabilities of the costume made for a funny situation when it accidentally changed color.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had the modulabilities of a chameleon, always adapting to new challenges.
meanings.sent5: The modulabilities of the tool made it indispensable for the workshop.
